titleStmt.title: Frank E. Walcott to Thomas E. Bramlette
CWG12193

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.collection: 1st - 20th Regiments Kentucky Infantry Primary Source Documents
msIdentifier.idno: Box 8, Folder Box 8, Folder 20th Ky. Inf. - Misc

body.p:
20th Ky Inft
Louisville Ky
Jan 23 1864
To
His Excellency
Gov Bramlette

With this I have the honor to forward a transcript of the agregate column of the last monthly report of the 20th Ky. I delayed forwarding it for the purpose of obtaining the war department order relative to mustering officers in Regiments below the minimum: but was disappointed. trusting that I may soon receive an order for muster on my recd commission

I am
Very Respectfully
Your Obdt Servt
Frank E. Walcott
Capt_20th Ky Inft

20
Louisville, Ky
Jan'y 23rd 1864
Frank E. Walcott
Capt 20th Inf
Wishes to get an order to be mustered in his commission as major.
Strength of Regt -- Enlisted men and Com officers, which shows a gain from last Months report of 32 men by enlistment.
